cards.title: Live Monitoring
cards.description: Unified control panel keeps device status and usage under watch.

cards.title: High Performance
cards.description: Async NIO and memory reuse verified at 200 Mbps on a single host.

cards.title: Multi-endpoint
cards.description: Windows / Linux / macOS / Android / routers all supported.

items.title: Simple operations
items.description: Host-mode bootstrap registers nodes and tunnels automatically to minimize setup.

items.title: Flexible endpoints
items.description: Supports PCs, servers, Android, routers, and API integration with existing systems.

items.title: Governance & control
items.description: Role-based accounts, usage reports, device monitoring, replay control, and dual-side metering.

items.title: Resilient performance
items.description: HTTP / HTTPS / SOCKS5 ready with millisecond failover and massive throughput.

steps.title: Deploy in one script
summary: Prepare a Linux host with public network access and Docker installed.
Pull the majora3 all-in-one image from the official registry.
Run the stack in host mode with a persistent data volume.
Open the console: the first registered account becomes the admin user (demo credentials remain available).
steps.code:
yum install -y docker
docker pull registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/iinti/majora3:all-in-one
docker run -d --network host \
  -v ~/majora3-mysql-data:/var/lib/mysql \
  --name majora3 \
  registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/iinti/majora3:all-in-one
echo "Browse http://127.0.0.1:6879 and login with majora/majora"
echo "The first registered account becomes the admin user"

items.title: VPS nodes

items.title: Android 4G devices

concepts.title: Key Pillars at a Glance
concepts.intro: Understand Majora3 across five pillars to deploy and scale a controllable proxy network.

items.title: Pool strategies
items.description: Random, Static, Consistent and City pools balance stability, geo affinity and dynamic routing.

items.title: Endpoints
items.description: Onboard Linux, Windows, macOS, routers and Android with built-in NAT traversal for any device.

items.title: Rebinding
items.description: Refresh egress IPs via redial or flight mode; rebind plans control scope, cadence and audit results.

items.title: Security & performance
items.description: Dual-account governance, ACL enforcement and event-driven architecture with full-funnel telemetry at 200 Mbps.
